frameDefinitions: A Perceiver determines the Location of a Sought_entity within a Ground.
In this frame a Patient is in a phase brought about after a change of phase.
These words describe the recovery or healing of a Patient from an Affliction without reference to the influence of any Treatment or Healer (see the Cure frame).  ''
An Entity persists in a stable situation called a State
An Executive_authority exercises their power to reduce or remove negative consequences for someone who has been labeled an Offender who participated in an Crime.
In this frame a Patient undergoes a change of phase.
frameExamples: Kim <t>found</t> his hat on the far side.
Collect up the  <t>thawed</t> water from the freezer section.
My injuries had not yet completely <t>healed</t>.

A Fort Worth man convicted of a robbery his brother later confessed
to committing was granted <t>clemency</t> on December 20, 2002, by Governor Rick Perry.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual that determines the <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> succeeds in finding.
The position of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The general set of entities that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> examined in order to find the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Sought_entity</fen> is located.
The <fen>Substance</fen> is the entity which has had its phase altered.
The    Patient may either be expressed as the External Argument or, as in Health.Cure, may occur as the possessor of the Affliction (an example of role conflation):
This role is the injury, pain or disease experienced by the Patient.  Affliction occurs either as an External Argument of verbs or as a PP Complement of nouns or verbs:
Where Body Part is expressed as a separate constituent (rather than in phrases such as <ment>the wound on Pat's arm</ment>), it occurs as an External Argument:
The time at which the recovery takes place.
The location where the recovery takes place.
Concrete or abstract entity
State of an Entity.
The individual who is accused or convicted of a <fen>Crime</fen>.
An action deemed criminal by law.
The constitutionally specified authority who has the power to grant clemency.
The time at which clemency is granted.
The location at which the <fen>Executive_authority</fen> grants clemency.
<fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that undergoes a change of phase.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Patient</fen> changes phase.
Where the <fen>Patient</fen> changes phase.
listRoleExamples: <fex>I</fex> finally found the peanut underneath the couch cusion.
Sam located the Imperial regal <fex>among the coins in his pocket</fex> and passed it to the boy.

Since 1976, <fex>225 death row inmates</fex> have been granted clemency for humanitarian
reasons.
I never saw a legal case where a person was given clemency <fex>for murder</fex>.
Mr. Papa was granted clemency for a drug conviction <fex>by Mr. Pataki</fex>, and released in 1997

In addition to Ms.  White, 55, Mr.  Pataki granted clemency <fex>yesterday</fex> to three men serving long prison terms for offenses under the stern Rockefeller-era drug laws that mandate long sentences for some relatively low-level drug crimes.
Apparently, no woman has ever been granted clemency <fex>there</fex>.
